bibl.title: Davis v. Davis. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The First Judicial District Court

div1.p: care for, clothe and educate said child, being possessed of a home, and sufficient property to maintain it comfortably, while the said Sarah M. Davis,has no property, with which to maintain said child, and is possessed of no home other than that provided her by your Petitioner.
And your Petitioner is willing and desires to have the custody and control of said child and to maintain and care fo for and educate it, as befits its station in life.

Wherefore your Petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said Sarah M. Davis commanding her to have the body of the the said MaggieMDavis the minor child aforesaid, before your Honor, at a time and place therein to be specified, to so and receive what shall there be considered, concerning the custody of the said Maggie Davis, together with the cause of her detention of the said child as aforesaid, and that the said minor child be restored to the care and custody of your Petitioner,and such other and further relief may seem meet to the Court in the premises
Territory of Washington, " " ss County of Whitman, " "
Nelson Davis, the Petitioner above named, being first duly sworn, says, that he has heard the foregoing peition read, and knows the contents thereofl; and that the same is true as he verily believes.
Subscribed and sworn to " before me this 27 day of " November, A.D., 1888. "
